Grand MasterAnswered on 05 Sep 2019Switching career is always a tough choice.I could be wrong but from what I know, switching career in the 40s is more tough as new employers are reluctant to hire anyone with no prior experience.Even if you are willing to start with low pay, it does not fit in their planning as they probably have a decent budget to hire someone with higher pay but the proper experience.So if you want to switch, late 30s is better NOW than never.=)PS: If you mean is compliance is a good career move, no idea what your current prospect is, but yes I heard of many guys in compliance with decent pay and great promotion prospects.
